The Origin of April Fool's Day

While there are several hypotheses as to the origin of April Fool's Day, the prevailing theory is...

Spicy Stir-Fried Rice Cake Recipe

1. Add 2 cups of water, put in rice cakes, and turn the burner on to max heat to boil the water.
2. When the water starts boiling, add seasoning and stir well. Continue to boil.
3. When there is not too much broth left in the wok, add scallions, sesame seeds, and any additional seasoning that you like. Voil!

Firing at the ring and inflicting enough damage will interrupt the enemy's special attack.
It indicates the damage dealt to the Cancel Ring of the enemy when fired upon.
If you find words like "stack 10 time(s)" in the skill description, that means this effect is stackable.
Refers to the buff stack count.
However, stack count of the debuff will be excluded.
This effect allows you to re-enter current Burst Skill Stage but not proceed to the next stage.
If another Nikke with the same stage of Burst Skill is on the field, the caster will be able to use her skill again and then enter the next Burst Stage.
Indicates the Burst Skills that cause damage to a single target.
This refers to the <color=#00AEFF>"Burst Skill damage"</color> of Burst Skills with the phrase "Affects 1 enemy unit(s)" in the description.
This refers to the <color=#00AEFF>"Deals n% of ATK as damage" effect</color> of Burst Skills with the phrase "Affects 1 enemy unit(s)" in the description.
Examples include the Burst Skills of Brid, Guillotine, etc.
Examples include the Burst Skills of Brid, Guillotine, etc.
Renders the player immune to single-target attacks.
However, this effect will be immediately lost upon being hit by area-based or multi-target attacks.
The effect will disappear once all allies aside from self are out of action.
This effect will remove debuffs from those who receive it.
If the number of dispels is less than the number of dispellable debuffs, debuffs will be affected in the order that they were applied.
The effect protects Nikkes from being knocked out when an attack deals damage that exceeds their HP. Instead, they will survive with the lowest HP possible.
Despite being in the state of indomitability, they will still be out of action upon suffering instant-kill attacks.
Before activating indomitability, they will immediately be out of action when hit by an instant-kill attack.
The damage dealt to enemies' projectiles.
Only effective on destructible projectiles of enemies.
The damage dealt by Wind Code enemies.
You can check detailed information about an enemy's code in Enemy Info and Battlefield Info before entering battle.
Each elemental code has a corresponding elemental code weakness.
When attacking an enemy with an elemental code weakness, additional damage referred to as "Superior Elemental Code Attack Damage" is dealt.
Grants immunity to Stun while activated.
If a Nikke is stunned at the moment the effect activates, Stun will be dispelled at once. She will be immune to Stun for the remaining duration.
Refers to damage dealt when attacking destroyable parts.
This effect duplicates a part of the designated ally's ATK and adds it to the ATK of the effect's target.
This effect duplicates a part of the designated ally's max HP and adds it to the max HP of the effect's target.
The filling speed of Burst Gauge, which must be filled in order to enter Burst Stage.
The Burst Gauge's capacity varies according to weapon types and Nikke features.
This effect instantly fills the Burst Gauge by a certain amount.
This allows you to enter Burst Stage and cast Burst Skills when the Gauge is fully filled.
This effect rebuilds cover that has been destroyed.
Destroyed covers will instantly be rebuilt with a certain amount of HP.
This effect will not be triggered when no cover has been destroyed or some HP of cover still remained.
This effect recovers Cover's HP.
Only effective to Covers with remaining HP. Does not apply to completely destroyed Covers.
While activated, damage dealt to the effect's target is accumulated. At the end of the duration, all of the accumulated damage is distributed to all enemies.
While activated, damage dealt to the target is accumulated. At the end of the duration, all of the accumulated damage is distributed to all enemies.
There is a limit to how much damage can be accumulated. The higher the caster's ATK, the more damage can be accumulated.
There is a limit to how much damage can be accumulated. The higher the caster's ATK, the more damage can be accumulated.
This effect distributes damage equally.
Damage is calculated based on the damage about to be taken by the designated enemy, and will be distributed and dealt evenly according to the number of enemies on the field.
When one enemy is on the field, it will take all the damage. When there are three enemies, each will take one-third of the accumulated damage.
Decreases cooldown of Skill 2 by {function_dec_value02} sec.
Indicates all enemies within the designated area when using skills manually.
Indicates the random target enemy and any surrounding enemies when using skills automatically.
Prioritizes a specific class as the target.
When there is no specific class, other targets will be selected.
This effect will remove buffs from those who receive it.
If the number of dispels is less than the number of dispellable buffs, buffs will be affected in the order that they were applied.

Capo dei Capi

The Ark's Little Idol
Angel Syuen
Missilis Internet Stream

My name is Syuen. 
I'm the beautiful and young CEO of Missilis Industry, one of the Big Three of the Ark. 
You can pretty much say that I'm adored by everyone in the Ark!

But lately, someone has been bothering me.
He's a rookie commander who just graduated from the military academy. And the thing is, he's so cold toward me!

Hmph, just wait and see! I'll definitely make you my captive. In the face of my charm, even the most handsome, kind, and smart commander will be helpless. 
Because I'm the Ark's little idol, Syuen!

Bring me the idol-addicted bastard who wrote this garbage "fanfiction", right now!

The back row refers to the second and fourth red slots.

All lower-tier effects activate when conditions of higher tiers are met.
Take Liter's Skill 1 as an example. Depending on the number of Burst Skill uses, max ammunition capacity increases after 1 use, critical damage increases after 2 uses, and ATK increases after 3 uses.

When using the Burst Skill for the third time, the effects from the first and second uses activate simultaneously due to the stacking of lower-tier effects, increasing max ammunition capacity, critical damage, and ATK.
The fulfilled conditions will be reset when the Nikke revives after being out of action.

This effect changes the Nikke's Burst stage.
For example, if the Burst Stage is changed to Stage 1, her Burst Skill will then transition to Burst Stage 2.
This effect deals damage as strong element to certain elements.
If a Fire Code Nikke gains the effect to deal damage as strong element to Electric Code enemies, that Nikke will be able to deal damage as strong element to both Electric Code and Wind Code enemies.
The effect will not add an additional weakness as it does not generate 2 codes.

A projectile that attaches to the target location before exploding at a specific time.
Attachable to:
- Raptures (including parts)
- Shields
- Nikkes
- Cover
- Decoy

If unable to attach to the target or object it hits, it will immediately explode upon collision and deal damage.
Unattachable to:
- Cancel Ring (interruption part)
- Indestructible background objects
- Projectiles
The code barrier, which can only be pierced through by Nikkes of a certain code, does not obstruct the projectile from attaching to its target location.
Attachable projectiles explode all at once and deal damage when the attached target disappears, the subject who fired them disappears, or when the phase switches.
A squad can use up to 50 attachable projectiles. If this limit is exceeded, the earliest attached ones will explode first and inflict damage.
This effect increases the damage dealt when the projectiles are attached.
This effect is only applicable to attachable projectiles.
This effect increases the projectile explosion damage.
Projectile explosion damage applies to the explosions caused by Rocket Launchers and attachable projectiles.

Fires a laser beam from its neck, dealing damage to a single Nikke.
The Nikke who is hit is afflicted with the Toxic Substance status and takes stackable damage over time.
Fires laser beams from its neck continuously, dealing damage to a single Nikke.

Fires Poison Bubble Missiles continuously, dealing damage to a single Nikke.
The Nikke who is hit is afflicted with the Poison Bubble status and takes stackable damage over time.
The missiles can be intercepted.
Fires laser beams from its eyes, dealing damage to a single Nikke.

Spews poisonous gas from its mouth, dealing damage to all Nikkes.
Deals enhanced continuous damage to the Nikke who is hit based on the number of Poison Bubble stacks applied.

Strikes with its body, dealing damage to all Nikkes.
Can only be stopped through Special Interruption. Should an attempt at Special Interruption fail, the strike deals damage to all Nikkes.

Spews poisonous gas from its entire body, dealing damage to all Nikkes.
Deals enhanced continuous damage to the Nikke who is hit based on the number of Toxic Substance stacks applied.
Generates a code barrier when accumulating Poison Gas.
While the barrier is up, only Water Code Nikkes can deal damage.
Summons 2 clones.

Poison Bubble Status
Increases the continuous damage based on the number of stacks of Poison Bubble on the Nikke who is hit.
Summons clones that have the same appearance as Scarab.

Due to the explosion range, damage may still be taken even when under cover or with a shield.
